de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.manager
Class WorldManager

java.lang.Object
  de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.manager.WorldManager

public class WorldManager
extends java.lang.Object

The world manager is a singleton, which summarizes the functionality that the underlying layers provide. It collects all loosely filaments and provides a lightweight access to this underlying layer. So for example it is possible to register new world objects or get a complete world list. To name just two use cases.

Usage: 

 WorldManager.getInstance().
Note that some methods use the ApplicationConfigurationManager. Read the class documentation for further usage notes.

Since:
1.0
Version:
$Id: WorldManager.java 786 2010-07-05 22:59:22Z andre.koenig $

Method Detail

getInstance

public static WorldManager getInstance()
The world manager is a singleton class. It is not possible to create more than one instance.

Returns:
The WorldManager instance.

store

public void store(World world)
           throws WorldNotStorable,
                  DataAccessException
Adds a new world to the minerva system. All world information will be stored, except of the country relation data. The country id's for example, will be generated in the persistence layer. So with this method it is NOT possible to store the neighboring countries. You have to call this method to register the world initially. After that, you are able to create the connections between the countries and call this method again for country dependency storage. example: 
 World world = new World()
 
 // ...
 // Set the world information
 // world.setName("my World");
 // ... 
 Country sweden = new Country()
 sweden.setName("Sweden");
 // ...
 Country norway = new Country();
 norway.setName("Norway");
 // ...
 
 // Add the new world to minerva system
 WorldManager.getInstance().store(world);
 
 // Create the country relations
 world.connectCountries(sweden, norway);

 // Store the world.
 WorldManager.getInstance().store(world);

Parameters:
world - The world object, which should be stored.
Throws:
WorldNotStorable
DataAccessException - Common data access exception.

store

public void store(java.io.File worldFile)
           throws WorldFileExtensionException,
                  WorldFileNotFoundException,
                  WorldFileParseException,
                  WorldNotStorable,
                  DataAccessException
Imports a world from a given world import file. This file contains the world data and was generated by an external tool which is able to create playable minerva worlds.

Parameters:
File - The world import file (*.world)
Throws:
WorldFileExtensionException - Wrong file extension.
WorldFileNotFoundException - The given world import file wasn't found.
WorldFileParseException - The given world import file is not well-formed.
WorldNotStorable - If some common exception occured (e. g. country exists, etc.)
DataAccessException - Common data access exception.
See Also:
WorldFile

getList

public java.util.Vector<World> getList()
                                throws DataAccessException
Loads a world list from the persistence layer.

Returns:
A vector with all worlds from the persistence layer.
Throws:
DataAccessException - Common data access exception.

getList

public java.util.Vector<World> getList(boolean lite)
                                throws DataAccessException
Loads a world list from the persistence layer.
IMPORTANT: If the 'lite' parameter is 'true', the method will only load the common world data (like: name, author, ...). If it is 'false' is behaves like the 'getWorldList' method and loads all complex world data (like country dependencies and so on).

Parameters:
lite - Does not load all country dependencies (only the world data).
Returns:
A vector with all worlds from the persistence layer.
Throws:
DataAccessException - Common data access exception.
See Also:
getList()

get

public World get(World world)
          throws WorldDoesNotExistException,
                 DataAccessException
Loads a world from the persistence layer by an given "incomplete" world. Incomplete means, that the world object must have a valid id. The method will fill the world object and returns it.

Parameters:
world -
Returns:
The "complete" world object.
Throws:
WorldDoesNotExistException - If the world wasn't found.
DataAccessException - Common data access exception.

loadDependencies

                       throws DataAccessException
Load country dependencies for a given world from the persistence layer.

Parameters:
world - The world for which we should load the country dependencies.
Throws:
DataAccessException - Common data access exception.
